result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Armand Louis Beauchamp

records.addlTxt: Correspondence with parties. Branch 16 is in receipt of defense counsel's letter to the court dated 10/27/2022- requesting Mr. Beauchamp's case be transferred to Judge Franke's court for a speedy plea/sentencing date. Court grants request and adjourns matter for a plea/sentencing hearing on 11/29/2022 at 10:00 am, RESERVE branch.
Received and Filed.Letter to Judge Grayson dated 10/27/2022.

Defendant Armand Louis Beauchamp not in court, in custody.  Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson appeared by video for Armand Louis Beauchamp. Attorney Annie Louk appeared in court on behalf of  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea/Sentencing. Clerk failed to notify Kettle Moraine to have Defendant appear Via Zoom Video Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Due to clerk error Court ordered case adjourned for Plea/Sentencing. Parties discussed potential Judicial Transfer. Case remains calendared in Branch 16.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 9, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements/Jury Instruction and State's Offer Letter received and filed.  bm
Jury Instructions received and filed.  bm

OFF THE RECORD: Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson in court, defendant Armand Louis Beauchamp not in court, in custody.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Plea/Sentencing hearing. All parties appear via zoom.
Court is unable to produce the Defendant for today's hearing, due to reasons stated off the record.  The Court adjourns matter for additional Plea/Sentencing hearing so Defendant may be present.  Case adjourned to Br. 16.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson in court via zoom, defendant Armand Louis Beauchamp not in court, in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  The scheduling conference was held OFF THE RECORD via zoom.  Defense has discovery and the state's offer, requesting a plea and sentencing date. The court adjourned the matter back to Branch 16 via zoom for plea and sentencing date on 7/1/22 at 3:00pm.

Defendant Armand Louis Beauchamp in court with Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson.  Defendant Armand Louis Beauchamp in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson in court by video, defendant Armand Louis Beauchamp not in court, in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. Attorney Bonneson is newly appointed and needs time to meet with his client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Paul Bonneson received and filed
Attorney Matthew Lamke received and filed

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Pretrial Order, signed and filed.

DAR UNAVAILABLE DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES.  CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD.
Defendant Armand Louis Beauchamp in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Armand Louis Beauchamp in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Armand Louis Beauchamp appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
